titlestmt.titleproper: Asian American Reproductive Justice Oral History Project, 2012-2014
titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid exported into EAD from InMagic DB/Textworks 14.0. Encoded by Margaret Jessup. September 30, 2014

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Asian American Reproductive Justice Oral History Project oral histories
did.abstract: Feminists; Journalists; Social reformers; Reproductive health advocates. Seventeen oral history interviews conducted by Juhee Kwon with organizers in the Reproductive Justice movement with the specific aim of capturing voices of Asian American women and their fight for reproductive justice since the 1980s. [NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

bioghist.p: As an undergraduate at Brown University, Juhee Kwon (Class of 2014 with a B.A. in Biology and Ethnic Studies) interviewed organizers in the Reproductive Justice movement with the specific aim of capturing voices of Asian American women and their fight for reproductive justice since the 1980s.

scopecontent.p: Seventeen oral history interviews (audio recordings and transcripts) conducted by Juhee Kwon with organizers in the Reproductive Justice movement with the specific aim of capturing voices of Asian American women and their fight for reproductive justice since the 1980s. Collection includes photographs, published materials, author's note, and original grant proposal.
Audio recordings and transcripts for most interviews are available online

accessrestrict.p:
The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection with the following caveats:
Interview with Kiran Ahuja - closed until January 1, 2017
Interview with Yin Ling Leung - closed until January 1, 2025
Interview with Julia Liou - in-house access only; access agreement required
Interview with Eveline Shen - closed
Interview with Helen Zia - permission from narrator required to access interview

userestrict.p: The Sophia Smith Collection owns copyright to the interviews, except for the interviews with the following women: Kiran Ahuja, Sophya Chum, Lora Jo Foo, Amy Lam, Yin Ling Leung, Julia Liou, Beckie Masaki, Peggy Saika, Eveline Shen, and Helen Zia. These women have retained copyright to their interviews. Permission must be obtained to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." Requests for permission to publish quotations should be addressed to the Sophia Smith Collection and should include identification of the specific passages to be quoted, anticipated use of the passages, and identification of the user. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Asian American Reproductive Justice Oral History Project, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

altformavail.head: Additional Formats
altformavail.p: Audio recordings and transcripts for most interviews are available online

accruals.p: Electronic database records were transferred to secure storage; file list is available.

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated to the SSC by Juhee Kwon in 2014.
